page.title: 18PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: The original part of{St John's {Church, Wotton}was built in 950 but it was destroyed by fire. The later church was built in 1150. About 15 people attend services each Sunday. One wedding and four christenings are usually held each year. The church is in a striking situation on the slope of{Ranmore. The church is small and singular in many ways. In the graveyard there are two valuable griffins which were stolen but replaced later. {Holy Trinity church in Westcott was funded by local people. It was designed in{Sussex stone}with a tiled roof by{Gilbert Scott}in 1852. The clock was added in 1887. {St John's Free Church}is a chapel situated in Furlong Road, Westcott. It was built in 1840. 2 services are held at the chapel each Sunday.
